channel.title: Client/Server Source For LInux?
channel.description: been looking around, and i was wondering if anyone had an open source client/server codded for a Linux based OS?

item.title: Client/Server Source For LInux?
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

both compiling / running if possible please

Read full topic

item.title: Client/Server Source For LInux?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“squal707, post:6, topic:342346”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=438759.msg3225381#msg3225381 date=1275524850]

yes i know, but Java is codded different for Linux, a server codded on windows will work but it takes time recoding it to compile with Java on Unix

No… it doesn’t…
[/quote]

alright sorry, shell scripting is different from windows batch for compiling / running a server

[quote author=Evil_ link=topic=438759.msg3225383#msg3225383 date=1275525073]

Java is platform independent. As long as you compile the files yourself, it will work.
[/quote]Actually the files can be compiled from anywhere and run anywhere. The beauty of java is compile once, run anywhere. So, every private server created (in java) is inherently capable of being ran (and compiled) on linux, mac, windows, anything that has the jdk.

thanks for the post, been looking around and can’t find a guide on how to do it, mind pointing me in the right direction?[/quote]

What part, compiling or running?

Read full topic

item.title: Client/Server Source For LInux?
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:342346”][quote author=squal707 link=topic=438759.msg3224511#msg3224511 date=1275445768]
yes i know, but Java is codded different for Linux, a server codded on windows will work but it takes time recoding it to compile with Java on Unix
[/quote]

No… it doesn’t…[/quote]

alright sorry, shell scripting is different from windows batch for compiling / running a server

[quote=“Evil_, post:5, topic:342346”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=438759.msg3224483#msg3224483 date=1275443896]
Java is platform independent. As long as you compile the files yourself, it will work.
[/quote]Actually the files can be compiled from anywhere and run anywhere. The beauty of java is compile once, run anywhere. So, every private server created (in java) is inherently capable of being ran (and compiled) on linux, mac, windows, anything that has the jdk.[/quote]

thanks for the post, been looking around and can’t find a guide on how to do it, mind pointing me in the right direction?

Read full topic
